body:
![dancing nodebot](http://media.giphy.com/media/Nc9ZF5xS2nRnO/giphy.gif)

# Nodebots
We can use node.js, and all the stuff we're learning in class, to program little robot-like computers. This is what node-bots is all about.

## johnny-five
[johnny-five](https://www.npmjs.com/package/johnny-five) is the thing that bridges the gap between node.js and the devices that operate in the physical world, like Arduinos and Raspberry Pis. It's a node module, so you can install it and require it just like *fs* or *express*.

## Hello world
If you have an Arduino, follow these instructions to get your board connected. If you don't have a board, no problem, you can still get started with nodebot-workshop...

## nodebot-workshop
[nodebot-workshop](https://www.npmjs.com/package/nodebot-workshop) is a little command line program that gives you series of easy code challenges that teach you how to write node.js for the Arduino. Do a global install and then run it from the command line. It works whether you have a board connected or not.
